Articles.Content:
I stumbled upon this program while reading XKCD, tried the demo and immediately fell in love.

This simulator is very cool and I've had fun blowing up ships and learning how to get to orbit. Now, however, I'm getting better and my little Kerbalnaut is actually surviving some of my test flights. Therein lies my problem. Once you land safely, how do you get back to the hangar to rebuild or start over. The only way I've been able to figure it out is to exit the game and restart.

What am I missing?

Thanks in advance for your assistance. I look forward to many wasted hours enjoying this simulation.

Welcome to the forums Maxthrust (More thrust for me....)

The XKCD comic actually brought someone into the game, they must of advertised it pretty well for you to try it out.

We all have fun blowing our kerbalnauts up without meaning it (Or maybe we do...) and in answer to your question, are you still using the Demo? Because I'm sure you can just press Escape when you have landed and click the End Flight Button, you would be able to leave flights there and resume them later but since you got the demo currently you can't. Try and buy the game eventually it's great, especially with the recent 0.17 update, adding planets and other moons to explore.

Have fun playing KSP and go blow up some rockets!

Oh, I bought the simulator after only a couple of hours playing the demo. It's a hoot.

I haven't tried the ESC....I'll do that now.

Thank you!

That was it Mustwin....too easy. I'm not sure how I missed that.

Thanks again.
